heisigStory: When we speak of burying something (or someone, for that matter), we usually mean putting them under ground. Only here, we are burying our beloved computer that has served us so well these past years. Behind us a choir chants the "Dies irae, dies illa" and there is much wailing and grief among the bystanders as they pass by to shovel a little dirt into what will be its final resting place. R.I.P.
koohiiStory1: You can´t bury computers underground, because of the dangerous heavy metals, so you hide them behind an equally large mound of soil and hope no-one notices.
koohiiStory2: I used SOIL to BURY my COMPUTER.
kunYomi: う.める、う.まる、う.もれる、うず.める、うず.まる、い.ける
readingExamples: 埋まる (う.まる), 埋める (う.める), 埋もれる (う.もれる)
words: to be buried, to be surrounded, to overflow, to be filled
